column5: I was driving to my first call this morning and stopped by a little pond I fish. I noticed that it looked really calm with no rippling on it and when I cast a crankbait out it floated on top. I guess someone must of dumped something in their because the top of the water was all hard. I Called Glen in Alabananas to see if he had any ideas but he is stumped too.  Art
Hmmmm....sounds like an ecological disaster!!!  This has something to do with global warming or pollution!!! I just know it!!!

Funny you mention this, I think it might be a fairly wide spread problem.....I too noticed a local pond that wasn't right.....this one was all covered in white stuff????  I was afraid to venture near enough to examine it closely...sure hope someone can fix this......  blyght
LOL Art  Get a heavier bait!  Whopper

I think you should see if that crusty stuff on top of your pond tastes funny.  Give it a lick tomorrow morning and get back to us with your observations.  I for one am very curious how this taste test will work out.  Stick to it, Art, you'll get it figgered out.
try walkin on it, that should be heavy enough,  maybe it's a mirage
NO, NO, NO, Art, at this time of year the only body bait to toss out is the CIL Wobbler, lol. And, in the business Glen is in, he should have access to a good supply.
Always the scientist.  I bet it tastes like chocolate.
must be a sign from the fishing gods....hhhmmmmmmmm
Shoulda used the usual late fall bait...TNT.Get the net! Joe
you know what they say... if the ponds broken call a plumma
be careful if the covering has any yellow spots don't lick um

Funny thing I went out their today and it was soft again. I guess someone else came along and found it and was smart enough to fix it. Sure hope it does not break again to soon... I will keep your test in mind if it happens again DouG I can always trust and rely on  the advise of a socket rcienist.  Art
